sections.text:
77-2306.State funds; depositories; security in lieu of bonds.

In lieu of a bond as provided in section 77-2305, any bank making application to become a depository under the provisions of sections 77-2301 to 77-2309 may give security as provided in the Public Funds Deposit Security Act to the State Treasurer.

SourceLaws 1891, c. 50, § 3, p. 348;Laws 1897, c. 23, § 2, p. 188;Laws 1899, c. 74, § 1, p. 321;Laws 1905, c. 151, § 1, p. 595;Laws 1907, c. 142, § 1, p. 450;Laws 1909, c. 139, § 1, p. 493;R.S.1913, § 6657;C.S.1922, § 6188;Laws 1927, c. 34, § 1, p. 153;C.S.1929, § 77-2503;Laws 1931, c. 135, § 1, p. 276;Laws 1933, c. 147, § 1, p. 564;Laws 1935, c. 152, § 2, p. 560;C.S.Supp.,1941, § 77-2503;R.S.1943, § 77-2306;Laws 1959, c. 263, § 13, p. 944;Laws 1967, c. 507, § 1, p. 1707;Laws 1989, LB 377, § 12;Laws 1995, LB 384, § 29;Laws 1996, LB 1274, § 27.

Cross ReferencesPublic Funds Deposit Security Act, see section 77-2386.
